page.title: 10A small fen farm 1
page.content: The size of my farm is 175 acres, it is all made up of fields, the smallest fields are about 5 acres and the average size field is about 10 acres. I have 20 fields the biggest is about 20 acres. The farm is a fairly averge one for the fens. It is not very big for farms nowadays. It is not the biggest farm in Whittlesey for there are some very large ones which are 1000 acres. But the farm is of a fair size and I could expand it if I wanted to. The type of soil is black peat it is about 18 inches or 2 feet deep under the peat is clay. Peat is very good soil but it shrinks when it dries out. The fens are drained by dykes and rivers all the water is pumped off the land by electric pump. The Fenland Drainage Board is responsible for this, we pay a land drainage rate.
